import pandas as pd 
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

df = pd.read_csv("../input/5minute-crafts-video-views-dataset/5-Minute Crafts.csv")
df.head()
source.f4d67dac:
import numpy as np 
corr = df.corr()
mask = np.triu(np.ones_like(corr, dtype=bool))
f, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(11, 9))
cmap = sns.diverging_palette(230, 20, as_cmap=True)
sns.heatmap(corr, mask=mask, cmap=cmap, vmax=.3, center=0,
            square=True, linewidths=.5, cbar_kws={"shrink": .5})
source.d01a72c1:
import string 
from collections import Counter 
from nltk.corpus import stopwords
stopwords = stopwords.words("english")
punctuation = string.punctuation

text = " ".join(df['title'])
text = text.lower()
text = "".join(_ for _ in text if _ not in punctuation)
text = [t for t in text.split() if t not in stopwords]
text = [t for t in text if not t.isdigit()]

x = [_[0] for _ in Counter(text).most_common(15)]
y = [_[1] for _ in Counter(text).most_common(15)]

plt.figure(figsize=(8,6));
ax = sns.barplot(x=y, y=x)
ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
plt.title("Most Frequent Keywords used in 5 Minute Craft Video Titles");
plt.xlabel("Frequency", fontsize=14);
plt.yticks(fontsize=14);
plt.xticks(fontsize=14);
# plt.ylabel("Average Views", fontsize=14);
source.5954f536:
## 5-Minute Crafts: Video Titles Exploration 

5-Minute Craft channel's content consists largely of videos relating to crafts and life hacks, styled in how-to formats, and occasionally, science experiments. As of October 2021, it is the 9th most-subscribed channel on the entire Youtube. Irrespective of all the criticism the channel gets, they do quite alot on the platform in engaging the viewers and increasing the views. There may be factors such as promotional budgets etc which may lead to increased views. In this dataset and noteboo we try to explore the way they write the titles. There may be some keywrds or some text features that may have impact on total views. 


### 1. Load Dataset
